home.title: Management System
home.description: This system allows you to effectively and efficiently manage and track your tasks, as well as other functionalities.

information.express: Express was used as the backend framework to create and manage routes using a RESTful API.
information.angular: Angular was employed to develop the user interface, with reusable components and a router for smooth navigation.
information.mongodb: MongoDB as a NoSQL database to store the data of tasks and users.

angular.title: Angular
angular.description: In this task management project, Angular was chosen for its advantages in developing complex applications and because it offers a wide range of tools and functionalities that enable better data management and a more user-friendly interface along with NG-ZORRO.

structure.title: Project Structure
structure.description: In the tree view, you can find the frontend application files. On the other hand, the 'window' displays the code corresponding to the selected file in the tree view, allowing for easy visualization and understanding of its structure and functionality.

Internationalization.title: Internationalization
Internationalization.description: Manage language localization and translations in your application.

libraries.title: Used Libraries
libraries.description: The library section lists the libraries or frameworks utilized in the frontend application. These libraries provide additional functionalities, utilities, or tools that enhance the development process and enable efficient code implementation.

components.name: auth0/angular-jwt
components.description: Angular wrapper for the JWT decoding utility at https://github.com/auth0/angular2-jwt.

components.name: fortawesome/fontawesome-free
components.description: A library of free icons to use with the FontAwesome icon set.

components.name: ngrx/effects
components.description: A library for handling side effects and asynchronous actions in NgRx.

components.name: ngrx/router-store
components.description: A library for integrating the Angular router with NgRx.

components.name: ngrx/store-devtools
components.description: A set of development tools for debugging and inspecting the NgRx store.

components.name: ngrx/store
components.description: A state management library for Angular applications based on Redux.

components.name: ngx-translate/core
components.description: A library for implementing internationalization (i18n) in Angular applications.

components.name: ngx-translate/http-loader
components.description: An Http loader for ngx-translate to load translations from a server.

components.name: Bootstrap
components.description: A popular CSS framework for building responsive web pages designed for mobile devices.

components.name: Bootstrap Icons
components.description: A set of free and open-source icons designed to work with Bootstrap.

components.name: ng-zorro-antd
components.description: A UI component library for Angular based on Ant Design.

express.title: Express
express.description: Express is a powerful Node.js framework used in our management system for building robust and scalable web applications. It provides a range of features and capabilities that enhance the development process and enable efficient handling of requests and responses.

structure.title: Project Structure
structure.description: In the tree view, you can find the backend application files. On the other hand, the 'window' displays the code corresponding to the selected file in the tree view, allowing for easy visualization and understanding of its structure and functionality.

components.name: bcrypt
components.description: bcrypt is a library used for hashing passwords securely. It provides a robust implementation of the bcrypt hashing algorithm.

components.name: bcryptjs
components.description: bcryptjs is a JavaScript implementation of the bcrypt hashing algorithm. It offers a simple and straightforward way to hash passwords.

components.name: body-parser
components.description: body-parser is a middleware that parses incoming request bodies in a middleware-friendly format. It simplifies the handling of HTTP request data.

components.name: cookie-parser
components.description: cookie-parser is a middleware used for parsing cookies in Node.js. It makes it easy to read and manipulate cookies in HTTP requests and responses.

components.name: cors
components.description: cors is a middleware that enables Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) in Express applications. It allows controlled access to resources from different origins.

components.name: dotenv
components.description: dotenv is a zero-dependency module that loads environment variables from a .env file into the process.env object. It simplifies the management of configuration values.

components.name: express
components.description: express is a fast, unopinionated, and minimalist web application framework for Node.js. It provides a robust set of features for building web applications and APIs.

components.name: express-rate-limit
components.description: express-rate-limit is a middleware that enables rate limiting in Express applications. It helps protect against abusive or malicious requests by limiting the number of requests per IP or user.

components.name: i18n
components.description: i18n is a library that facilitates internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n) in Node.js applications. It provides tools for managing translations and supporting multiple languages.

components.name: jsonwebtoken
components.description: jsonwebtoken is a library for generating and verifying JSON Web Tokens (JWT) in Node.js. It enables secure communication and authentication between parties using digitally signed tokens.

components.name: mongoose
components.description: mongoose is an object modeling tool for Node.js and MongoDB. It provides a straightforward way to interact with MongoDB databases and define data schemas.

components.name: morgan
components.description: morgan is a logging middleware for Express applications. It logs HTTP requests and provides detailed information about each request, such as the HTTP method, URL, and response status.

components.name: nodemon
components.description: nodemon is a utility that automatically restarts the Node.js application when file changes are detected. It improves the development workflow by eliminating the need for manual restarts.

components.name: passport
components.description: passport is an authentication middleware for Node.js. It provides a flexible and modular way to implement authentication strategies, such as username/password, OAuth, and JWT.

components.name: passport-jwt
components.description: passport-jwt is a Passport strategy for authenticating with JSON Web Tokens (JWT). It allows you to authenticate and authorize requests by validating the JWT present in the request headers or cookies.

components.name: passport-local
components.description: passport-local is a Passport strategy for authenticating with a username and password. It provides a simple and customizable way to authenticate users against a local database or any other data source.

routes.title: Express Routes
routes.description: Below is a list of all the available routes in the Express backend and their corresponding methods:

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description: This section explains the authentication process in the system.

jwt.title: JSON Web Token (JWT)
jwt.description: JWT is an open standard for creating secure access tokens. It allows authenticating and authorizing requests in the system.
jwt.step1: The client logs in and sends its credentials to the server.
jwt.step2: The server verifies the credentials and generates a unique JWT that contains the authentication information.
jwt.step3: The server sends the JWT to the client, who will store it and send it in every protected request.

passport.title: Passport
passport.description: Passport is a flexible authentication middleware for Node.js. It provides an easy way to authenticate requests in the system.
passport.strategy2: passport-jwt: JSON Web Token (JWT) based authentication.
passport.strategy3: passport: authentication based on other custom strategies.
passport.howToUse: How to use Passport in the system:

mongodb.title: MongoDB
mongodb.description: This project utilizes MongoDB as a NoSQL database for efficient storage and management of data.

introduction.title: Introduction to MongoDB
introduction.text1: MongoDB is a NoSQL document database that provides a flexible and scalable solution for storing and managing data in your application. In this project, we use MongoDB as our database technology to store user information, task data, and authentication tokens.
introduction.text2: We have defined several schemas using Mongoose, an ODM (Object Data Modeling) library for MongoDB and Node.js, to define the structure and behavior of our data models. For example, the User schema represents user data, the Token schema handles authentication tokens, and the Task schema represents task-related information.
introduction.text3: Here's an example of a user schema defined in the backend:

dataModeling.title: Data Modeling
dataModeling.description: Data modeling in MongoDB involves designing the structure of documents and the relationships between them.
items: Each task was represented as a JSON document in the 'tasks' collection.
The document fields include 'title' (task title), 'description' (task description), 'assignee' (task assignee), and 'comments' (comments associated with the task).
dataModeling.exampleTitle: Example of data modeling in MongoDB for tasks:

basicOperations.title: Basic Operations
basicOperations.description: MongoDB offers CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations to interact with stored data.

changeLanguage.title: Idioma Cambiado
changeLanguage.description: El idioma se ha cambiado exitosamente
